alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Oconee; Oglethorpe; Wilkes (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 09 at 10:09AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Oconee, east central Morgan, northern Greene, west central Wilkes, Oglethorpe and southeastern Madison Counties through 1045 AM EST ... At 1009 AM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Arnoldsville to near Buckhead, and moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, Lexington, Union Point, Comer, Crawford, Arnoldsville, Woodville, Carlton, Maxeys, Buckhead, Stephens, Smithonia, Wrayswood, Hutchings, Greshamville, Carey, Swords, Penfield, Philomath, and Watson Mill Bridge State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
